globalSummary: The XRPL is secured by ~150 validators globally, with strong concentrations in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. The network maintains decentralization through diverse UNL configurations.

items.title: Ripple operates 6 validators across 3 continents
items.summary: Ripple maintains validators in US, EU, and Singapore for redundancy and geographic distribution.

items.title: MIT and University of Waterloo run academic validators
items.summary: Academic institutions contribute to network decentralization through independent validator operation.

items.title: SBI Holdings operates validators in Japan and Singapore
items.summary: SBI's validator infrastructure supports APAC transaction routing and regional resilience.

items.title: XRPL Foundation validators distributed across EU
items.summary: Foundation-operated validators in Germany, Netherlands, and UK ensure European coverage.

items.title: Community validators reach 40% of network consensus
items.summary: Independent community operators now represent a significant portion of recommended UNL validators.

items.title: Average consensus round completes in 3.8 seconds
items.summary: Global validator distribution maintains sub-4-second consensus despite geographic spread.
